main event: Radar operators detected a bright, stationary light that descended vertically at a rapid rate before fading out.
interesting points: The light was described as a bright, bluish-green color.
The manner of the light's appearance and disappearance led the witness to believe it was not an aircraft.
The radar target's behavior was consistent with that of a balloon, possibly with a heavier than normal load.
There were no known aircraft in the area at the time of the sighting.
The sighting occurred during heavy winds, rain showers, and thunderstorms in the area.
